instructions: From the Home screen swipe left, tap Settings . Tap About phone > Android version . Review the information in the Review software version details section below.
Tap Install and restart . Wait as your device updates.
From the Home screen swipe left, tap Settings . Tap About phone > System > System updates . Follow the on screen prompts to update the device.

Wipe your cache partition to make sure that all system files on your device are put back in order. Turn off the device. Press and hold the Volume Down button, then press and hold the Power button at the same time until the phone turns on. Release the buttons when the 'Recovery' screen appears. Press the Volume Down button twice to highlight 'Recovery mode'. Press the Power button to start recovery mode. An Android robot with a red exclamation mark will display. While holding down the Power button, press and release the Volume Up button. Use the volume buttons to scroll to 'wipe cache partition' and press the Power button to select it. Press the Power button to select reboot system now. If your phone becomes unresponsive at any point during these steps, you can restart it by holding down the Power button for several seconds. If wiping the cache partition does not work, you may need to perform a master reset . Back up data on the internal memory. Tap System > Reset . Tap Factory data reset . If your phone is password protected, you'll be prompted to enter your Pattern, PIN, or Password. Tap RESET PHONE .
Back up data on the internal memory. Tap System > Reset . Tap Factory data reset . If your phone is password protected, you'll be prompted to enter your Pattern, PIN, or Password. Tap RESET PHONE .
